page.title: 09Visiting Gayton Reserve
page.content: "We went on a school trip to the Nature Reserve on the 18th June. The man who made it told us everything about nature. The girls found about 10 different sorts of grass and wild flowers like "eggs and bacon". These were all common plants - he had some rare flowers too, like spotted orchids, but we couldn't pick those. The man who owned it saw a heron standing in one of the ponds looking for fish to eat but the heron flew away. He saw another heron in the winter-time standing on the ice looking for food. It was very thin but it didn't fly away - it was too weak. Then we went near the railway line and we saw some baby rabbits playing in the field. Before we went home we each had an Aylesbury duck egg."
